intro: Stephanomeria exigua subsp. deanei, commonly known as the Deane's stephanomeria, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a low-growing annual herb with narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as dunes and grasslands.
